back_cards.example_en: She had to admit her mistake to the team.

back_cards.definition_en: To allow entry into a place.
back_cards.example_en: They only admit members to the club.

back_cards.definition_en: To accept as true or valid.
back_cards.example_en: The court admitted the evidence.
He admitted that he was wrong about the plan.

back_cards.definition_en: To permit entry to an institution.
back_cards.example_en: The hospital admitted her for treatment.
She said hello to her neighbor at the store.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to answer a phone call.
back_cards.example_en: Hello, who’s this speaking?
Hello, can you hear me over there?
He started the email with a simple hello.

back_cards.definition_en: A casual greeting in social settings.
back_cards.example_en: Hello, it’s nice to see you at the party!

back_cards.definition_en: Moving to a position on something.
back_cards.example_en: She climbed onto the roof to fix the leak.
I’m onto your secret plan now.
Let’s move onto the next agenda item.
The cat jumped onto the table.
We’re moving onto the final stage of the project.
We sailed across the sea to reach the island.
A sea of flowers covered the meadow.
The sea is calm today for fishing.
She faced a sea of paperwork at work.
The battle took place at sea in 1805.
The food was okay, but not amazing.
It’s okay with me if we leave early.
Don’t worry, everything will be okay.
The weather is okay for a hike today.
Are you okay to start the meeting now?

back_cards.definition_en: The opening for eating and speaking.
back_cards.example_en: He put a spoonful of soup in his mouth.

back_cards.definition_en: The entrance to a cave or river.
back_cards.example_en: The river’s mouth opens into the ocean.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to express speech or opinions.
back_cards.example_en: She heard the news straight from his mouth.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of an animal’s anatomy.
back_cards.example_en: The dog’s mouth was full of foam.
Rumors spread by word of mouth.

back_cards.definition_en: In every part of a place.
back_cards.example_en: Flowers were planted throughout the garden.

back_cards.definition_en: During an entire period of time.
back_cards.example_en: She stayed focused throughout the meeting.
The rule applies throughout the company.
His fame spread throughout the country.
They danced throughout the night.
She built her own house from scratch.
He made the decision on his own.
Every child has their own book.
I have my own way of doing things.
They now own their dream car.

back_cards.definition_en: An examination of knowledge or skill.
back_cards.example_en: She studied hard for the math test.
The car passed the safety test.
They ran a test on the new software.
The storm was a test of our survival skills.
The doctor ordered a blood test.

back_cards.definition_en: A network created by a spider.
back_cards.example_en: A spider web glistened in the morning dew.

back_cards.definition_en: The internet or World Wide Web.
back_cards.example_en: I found the article on the web.
She’s caught in a web of lies.
The company’s web page is user-friendly.
The web in the corner trapped a fly.

back_cards.definition_en: To move something back and forth.
back_cards.example_en: Shake the bottle before opening it.
Her hands began to shake from the cold.
The news shook him deeply.
He shook the cocktail with ice.

back_cards.definition_en: To dislodge or remove by shaking.
back_cards.example_en: She shook the dust off the rug.

back_cards.definition_en: A warning of harm or danger.
back_cards.example_en: The storm posed a threat to the village.
Cyber attacks are a growing threat.

back_cards.definition_en: An expression of intent to harm.
back_cards.example_en: He ignored the threat from his rival.
Pollution is a threat to marine life.
The new store is a threat to local businesses.
They found a solution to the math puzzle.

back_cards.definition_en: A method to resolve an issue.
back_cards.example_en: Recycling is a solution to waste reduction.
The chemist tested the solution in the lab.
The treaty was a solution to the conflict.
The update provided a solution to the bug.
Please shut the door behind you.
They shut the factory for repairs.

back_cards.definition_en: To block out sound or light.
back_cards.example_en: She shut the curtains to sleep better.

back_cards.definition_en: To end a conversation or activity.
back_cards.example_en: He tried to shut the argument down.

back_cards.definition_en: To secure a place or object.
back_cards.example_en: We shut the windows before the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: Toward a lower position or place.
back_cards.example_en: She sat down on the bench.
The temperature went down overnight.

back_cards.definition_en: To a state of being off or closed.
back_cards.example_en: The system shut down unexpectedly.
Rain came pouring down all afternoon.

back_cards.definition_en: To a lower level or condition.
back_cards.example_en: He felt down after the bad news.

back_cards.definition_en: To go from one place to another.
back_cards.example_en: We plan to travel to Europe next summer.
She travels to work by train every day.
He loves to travel to remote villages.

back_cards.definition_en: To commute or go on a trip.
back_cards.example_en: They travel to the beach every weekend.
News travels fast in this town.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who conducts scientific research.
back_cards.example_en: The scientist discovered a new species.

back_cards.definition_en: An expert in a field of science.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a scientist studying climate change.

back_cards.definition_en: A professional in a lab setting.
back_cards.example_en: The scientist tested the new drug.
Scientists developed the new battery.
The scientist published a groundbreaking paper.
She hid behind the tree during the game.

back_cards.definition_en: To keep something out of sight.
back_cards.example_en: He hid the gift under the bed.
The cat likes to hide in the closet.
She hid her feelings with a smile.
They hid supplies in the basement.

back_cards.definition_en: In a way that is clear or evident.
back_cards.example_en: She was obviously upset about the news.
Obviously, we need more time to finish.
He’s obviously the best candidate.
Obviously, the plan didn’t work.
She’s obviously going to win the race.

back_cards.definition_en: To mention or direct attention to.
back_cards.example_en: She referred to the book during her speech.

back_cards.definition_en: To direct someone to a source.
back_cards.example_en: The doctor referred her to a specialist.

back_cards.definition_en: To relate or apply to something.
back_cards.example_en: The rule doesn’t refer to this case.

back_cards.definition_en: To consult or cite a reference.
back_cards.example_en: He referred to the manual for help.
They refer to it as the best cafe in town.
